metadata.title: CVE-2018-18314 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Perl before 5.26.3 has a buffer overflow via a crafted regular expressionthat triggers invalid write operations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgi-fast-perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
libperl5.18 - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
perl-base - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
perl-debug - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
perl-modules - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: perl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.18.2-2ubuntu1.6').
